TopicTitle: [0.23]Cargo Transfer Bags and Tanks(for TAC life support) 0.7

Articles.Content: No problem, this should be awesome

New version:

0.7

- Added Firespitter FStextureSwitch2 and FSfuelSwitch modules for easier texture and resource switching

- Removed modular manager support

- Changed the Pressurized Resupply Tank from 2 tanks to 1, mainly because the new fuel switch module doesn't support separate resource switching.

- Replaced the Cargo Transfer Bag texture with blackheart612's version.

Requires Firespitter 6.4 or higher

Wow, it's stable enough for release? I thought Snjo might still change stuff on FSTS2. Guess I should start releasing with it too *shrug*

Now we can change resource properly *thumbsup*

Hi .. i really like this mod, but there should be something implemented that restricts the content changing ability for the time in the vab (and maybe on launchpad). Right now you can change and reset the amount of food & co. in flight, and cheat yourself. Yes I know, nothing stops me from just dont do that, but it just doesnt feels right
I can't make this work,i only get the "blank" bags in the VAB

I can't make this work' date='i only get the "blank" bags in the VAB[/quote']

Do you have the newest firespitter.dll installed?
Yes,it's in the firespitter folder.

Hi .. i really like this mod, but there should be something implemented that restricts the content changing ability for the time in the vab (and maybe on launchpad). Right now you can change and reset the amount of food & co. in flight, and cheat yourself. Yes I know, nothing stops me from just dont do that, but it just doesnt feels right

Change "switchableInFlight = true" to "switchableInFlight = false" in the .cfg files. Your will shall no longer be taunted.

Change "switchableInFlight = true" to "switchableInFlight = false" in the .cfg files. Your will shall no longer be taunted.

Great Scot! Thank you very much

While I was on my free time, I decided to make a random food box derived from the design of nothke's superstrap... Well, it looks good so I thought I'd ask Albert if he wants the model (this is a prototype texture), and I thought again, why not post it here? It's the same size as the original Cargo Transfer Bag too.

I might make a tank too when I need to pass time.

Nope, I see Albert nowhere. I'm busy with my projects as well. This tank is set to have resources the same on both btw why? Because I realized that it's the main purpose of resource delivery and that's what this mod is for. I was planning on tending this mod for Albert (he got some stuff for me that I forgot to do but meh), I'm a little bit busy right now but once I find the time, do not worry, I'll be able to add my new parts as an option to the existing. I might even maintain it if he's busy. But that's gonna be soon since I can't at the moment.

Just curious, what are the size/mass based on for these? For instance, 60 days' worth of food for a human would be roughly 300 pounds. Water would be... considerable. Are those really the TAC values?

Just curious, what are the size/mass based on for these? For instance, 60 days' worth of food for a human would be roughly 300 pounds. Water would be... considerable. Are those really the TAC values?

Kerbals consume roughly 25% of a human. Anyway, those things are quite heavy, but Kerbals can carry a lot more heavy stuff in this game.

I don't aim at realism but a compromise with gameplay, if you want that please look at UniversalStorage (EVAExtender, etc.) which cares about realism as much as possible

-snip-
